snippet: People seeking to pray at the holy site in Jerusalem in less traditional fashion would have a separate area of their own.
abstract: Natan Sharansky, chairman of the Jewish Agency, outlines plan to make Western Wall in Jerusalem place where all Jews can pray comfortably; proposal involves expanding areas accessible for prayer and creating separate section for those wishing to pray in less Orthodox style; proposal is met with enthusiasm by feminist group Women of the Wall.
lead_paragraph: People seeking to pray at the holy site in Jerusalem in less traditional fashion would have a separate area of their own.

headline.seo: Plan to Resolve Western Wall Prayer Controversy
headline.main: Compromise Is Proposed on Western Wall Praying
headline.print_headline: Compromise Is Proposed On Western Wall Praying
